column4: a dpkg --set-selections (hold) does not prevent the actual package from showing up as available for update?
if "hold" does essentially the same as "lock" in synaptic, then "no", but I will try
in my case that seems not to help because I am talking about kernel versions, and they don't replace each other but just get added :-)
the original file is not touched without an erroneous redirection...
I learned that the hard way :)
codeshah package is openssh-server     apt-cache policy openssh-server
not exactly what you are looking for, but you could mount the mini.iso (-o loop) to see what actually happens in the various menuoptions
good idea - but it seems somewhat strange that it isn't documented anywhere
